***** Translingual[edit] *****
[//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/74/Deva-%E0%A4%9B-order.gif]
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /t͡ɕʰə/, /t͡ʃʰə/, /t͡sʰə/
**** Letter[edit] ****
छ (ch)
   1. A letter of the Devanagari_alphabet representing a heavily aspirated
      consonant, ch /tʃʰ/
**** See also[edit] ****
    * (Devanagari script consonants) क,‎ ख,‎ ग,‎ घ,‎ ङ,‎ च,‎ छ,‎ ज,‎ झ,‎ ञ,‎

      व,‎ श,‎ ष,‎ स,‎ ह,‎ ॸ,‎ त्र,‎ ज्ञ,‎ क्ष,‎ क़,‎ ख़,‎ ग़,‎ ज़,‎ ॹ,‎ झ़,‎
      ड़,‎ ढ़,‎ ष़,‎ य़,‎ ॺ,‎ ऴ,‎ ॻ,‎ ॼ,‎ ॾ,‎ ॿ (Category: Translingual

***** Kullu Pahari[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [c͡çʰ]
**** Letter[edit] ****
छ (ch)
   1. Used to represent the [c͡çʰ] sound in Kullui. [1]
***** Marathi[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /t͡ɕʰə/
Audio  (file)
**** Letter[edit] ****
छ • (cha)
   1. The sixth consonant in Marathi.
***** Nepali[edit] *****
     Nepali numbers (edit)
      60
 ←  5 ६              7  → 
      6
         Cardinal: छ (cha)
     Ordinal: छैटौँ (chaiṭa͠u)
    Multiplier: छगुना (chagunā)
**** Etymology 1[edit] ****
*** Pronunciation[edit] ***
    * IPA(key): [t͡sʰʌ]
    * Phonetic Devanagari: छ
*** Letter[edit] ***
छ • (cha)
   1. the seventh consonant in Nepali
**** Etymology 2[edit] ****
Inherited from Sanskrit षष् (ṣaṣ), cognate with Hindi छह (chah).
*** Numeral[edit] ***
छ • (cha)
   1. six
**** Etymology 3[edit] ****
*** Verb[edit] ***
छ • (cha)
   1. third-person singular low-respect defining present of हुनु (hunu)
***** Newar[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [t͡ɕʰə]
**** Numeral[edit] ****
छ • (cha)
   1. one
*** Alternative forms[edit] ***
    * छि (chi)
***** Pali[edit] *****
**** Alternative forms[edit] ****
Alternative forms
    * cha (Latin script)
    * 𑀙 (Brahmi script)
    * ছ (Bengali script)
    * ඡ (Sinhalese script)
    * ဆ or ꧡ (Burmese script)
    * ฉ or ฉะ (Thai script)
    * ᨨ (Tai Tham script)
    * ຉ or ຉະ (Lao script)
    * ឆ (Khmer script)
    * 𑄍 (Chakma script)
**** Numeral[edit] ****
छ (cha)
   1. Devanagari_script form of cha (“six”)
          o c. 500 AD, Kaccāyana,Pālivyākaraṇaṃ[Pali Grammar]‎[2], page 250;
            republished as Satish_Chandra_Acharyya_Vidyabhusana,
            editor,Kaccayana's Pali Grammar (edited in Devanagari character and
            translated into English), Calcutta, Bengal: Mahabodhi Society,
            1901:
                  अथ सब्बासं विभत्तीनं यानि यानि पुब्बानि छ पदानि तानि तानि
                  परस्सपदसञ्ञानि होन्ति।
                        Atha sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ yāni yāni pubbāni cha padāni,
                        tāni tāni parassapadasaññāni honti.
                        Then whatever are the first six endings of all the
                        endings, they are called the active endings.
*** Declension[edit] ***
Optionally indeclinable.
Declension table of "छ"
                     Case \ Number        Plural
                     Nominative (first)   छ (cha)
                     Accusative (second)  छ (cha)
                     Instrumental (third) छहि (chahi)
                     Dative (fourth)      छन्नं (channaṃ)
                     Ablative (fifth)     छहि (chahi)
                     Genitive (sixth)     छन्नं (channaṃ)
                     Locative (seventh)   छसु (chasu)
***** Prakrit[edit] *****
**** Numeral[edit] ****
छ (cha) (cardinal_number)
   1. Devanagari_script form of 𑀙
***** Sherpa[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /t͡sha/
**** Letter[edit] ****
छ (tsha)
   1. Used to represent the [t͡sʰ] sound in Sherpa. [3]
